title: Member Lecture: 10 Years of the Modern Wing
title_display: Member Lecture: 10 Years of the Modern Wing
description:
Join us for the 10th anniversary of the Modern Wing and hear from James Allan, executive director of planned giving and special gifts, as he recounts the short but fascinating history of the building and its collection. 

The Modern Wing is the most recent addition to the museum as well as the greatest departure from original museum architecture. It utilizes key contemporary design principles, such as the use of natural lighting and a façade of transparent, glazed walls that help meet the temperature and humidity conditions required for art while also surpassing Chicago Energy Code requirements. The most recent manifestation of our mission to show modern and contemporary art, the Modern Wing is the home of the Edlis-Neeson Collection, the largest donation in the museum’s history. 

For additional member programs, please visit the member programs calendar.
